# Electrical Wiring and Security System Upgrades for Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) Detachments
## Solicitation ID: M5000-24-1055/A
### Amendment 4

#### Tender Description

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is soliciting bids to upgrade electrical wiring and security systems for its detachments in Inuvik, Fort McPherson, Tuktoyaktuk, Fort Smith, Fort Simpson, and Behchoko in the Northwest Territories. The scope of work includes cabling upgrades for Closed Circuit Video Equipment (CCVE) and Intrusion Detection System (IDS) systems, as well as retrofitting of sites.

#### Tender Requirements

* A minimum of two electricians must be deployed for the contract, with at least one being a journeyman electrician.
* The contractor must hold a valid "Facilities Access Level II (FA2) with Escort" issued by RCMP Departmental Security.
* The project period is from the signing of the contract to March 31, 2026.

#### Tender Evaluation Criteria

Tenders will be evaluated based on a Highest Combined Score of Indigenous Participation Plan (IPP) and Price.

#### Indigenous Participation

The RCMP encourages bidders to submit an Indigenous Participation Plan (IPP) as part of their offer. The plan will be evaluated based on specific criteria outlined in the solicitation document.

#### Contract Terms

* The contract is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and must adhere to the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements, including the Gwich'in Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement, Inuvialuit Final Agreement, and Tlicho Agreement.
* The contractor and all personnel/subcontractors must comply with the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada.

#### Tendering Procedure

Tenders must be submitted to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at NWR_Procurement_Bids@rcmp-grc.gc.ca. Tender documents can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.

#### Notice of Tendering

Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. Bidders must regularly consult the GETS website for the most up-to-date information.
